name: LeedsTechHub
description:
Howdy!

LeedsTechHub is an event series and meetup community welcoming all those from a digital discipline and those wanting to learn more or build networks with those within the industry. We meet 1-2 times a month, usually on a Thursday evening and generally have 3 or 4 industry leading speakers plus free grub and beer. Event topics include iOS/Android development, JavaScript (Node / Angular / React / Ember), UX, Ruby, Java, Analytics…the list goes on!

Our meetups are often very kindly hosted at Sky HQ Leeds or at venues around Leeds - this requires some additional info for their security team - if you have your full name on your profile rather than a nickname this really helps. We are a sociable group and very welcoming to newcomers.

This group was established by some of the lovely folk at Sky in Leeds. Curious about what we do here in Leeds? http://www.workforsky.com/behind-the-scenes/changing-game... See you soon!

name: VSH Solutions Engineering Events
description: Meet and discuss people at VSH Solutions. We talk about cutting edge technologies and tools that help improving development workflow for developers. Some of the technologies we discuss are PHP, Node.js, MySQL, Postgresql, Android, iOS, React.js, Redux, Docker, Kubernetes, Agile Development, Cloud Computing, AWS, etc.

name: Arnold Open Source Meetup
description: This is a group for anyone interested in software development, open source, python, JavaScript, Java, node.js, IOT, or technology in general. All skills levels are welcome. I started this group to meet others interested in open source technology.

name: Santa Barbara JavaScript
description:
SB has Rails. SB has Python. SB has UX! But where is the JavaScript love? Want to escape your jQuery hammer? Want to learn the ins and outs of JavaScript the language?  Interested in ES6 and 7? Interested in using sweet new frameworks like React, Angular, Aurelia, Ember. Or maybe Node is your thing? Want to know different styles of programming like imperative, object-oriented, functional, or even functional reactive? Maybe learn how to test and organize your code better? Want to hack on cool projects? This could be for you! Come and join us.

Join our Slack network by signing up on this form: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSf11PAHrIcLb4VGbc5Afo33iIuLfvTfAz3GkwuPcBqPB_C_vw/viewform

name: Cross-Platform Afterwork
description:
Hey Cross-Plattform Entwickler! Hast Du Lust Dich mit anderen Cross-Plattform Entwicklern zu treffen und Dich über aktuelle Technologien (wie z.B. Angular, Cordova, Electron, Node.js oder .NET Core) zu unterhalten? Prima! Dann bist Du bei uns genau richtig. :-)

Einmal im Monat wollen wir in geselliger Runde bei Bier und Pizza uns 2-3 Stunden über aktuelle und kommende Technologien und über Probleme & Lösungen austauschen. Dabei wollen wir keine PowerPoint-Schlacht veranstalten, sondern jeder ist dazu angehalten sich einzubringen - sei es in Form von Diskussionen oder natürlich Hands-On in seinem bevorzugten Editor - also so richtig live & mit viel Code.

organizer.name: Manuel Rauber
organizer.bio: Software Developer (Angular 2, Node.js, .NET) - Open Source - <3 Espresso - working @thinktecture

name: Startup + Hackathon // SF Bay
description:
We're looking for founders, developers, and designers who want to build real tech startups at the hackathons of our DataWeek.co and DeveloperWeek.com conferences!

Our hackathons are usually the 'kick-off' events for our giant conferences where we invite dozens of speakers, advisors, and partners to provide coaching and free services for our hackathon teams.

 

You can expect direct coaching from 12+ silicon valley VC's and engineers in Node.js, MongoDB, Ruby on Rails, Javascript, HTML 5..... We've had advisors from Google, Twilio, 10gen MongoDB, General Catalyst Partners, Palantir, dotCloud, Battery Ventures, and dozens more.... and in 2013 we'll invite our advisor network to help turn your hackathon apps into full-scale startups!

organizer.name: Geoff Domoracki
organizer.bio: Founder / organizer of DataWeek.co and DeveloperWeek.com in San Francisco - Ex-CEO of Techweek.com - Amateur triathlete - occasional app inventor?

name: Code Craftsmanship Saturdays
description: Code Craftsmanship Saturdays is a meetup group where people can learn and practice both new and old technologies in an informal environment. People learn best when paired in groups where they can share different ideas, thoughts, and approaches to problems. This group is heavily influenced from the Node School Organization, but is intended to be more generic in content. This code retreat is about practice, not about delivering a product on a deadline. We will follow the format of a code retreat but the meetups will only be 4 hours long. Start now, try something new, get the fire back, the reason you started coding in the first place!

organizer.name: Jean-Marcel Belmont
organizer.bio: Software Engineer who loves learning and teaching newer technologies to my fellow developers.

name: Central PA Java Developers
description:
The Central PA Java Group is a new group in the Harrisburg area composed of passionate developers who use languages that run on the Java Virtual Machine (JVM). There was once a Java group in the Harrisburg area approximately 4-5 years ago, but this is a new & different group with new leadership and will have a different structure and focus. The group at this point is fairly small and we are well aware that the Java/JVM community in the Harrisburg area is not extremely large. However, we know that there are passionate developers in the area who want to meet other developers, learn more or want to get started with a Java or a JVM language.

The group will alternate between different meeting formats such as presentations, show & tell, open spaces or just meeting up socially to talk & network. Talks & learning meetups will include JVM languages (such as Java, Scala or Groovy) but any technology that a Java Developer would encounter is fair game. This could mean talks on JavaScript frameworks such as React or Angular, HTML5, Node.js, NoSQL databases, SQL Databases, Git, Design & Architecture, build systems like Maven or Gradle, Docker, and the list could go on.

We hope to meet roughly once a month. Please spread the word to anybody who you think would be interested!

organizer.name: Roger Diller
organizer.bio: I am a software developer & consultant from the general Harrisburg, PA area. I have extensive experience across many technologies including Java, Spring, Hibernate, Flex (Flash), web services, integrations, BI (iReport, JasperReports, some Crystal).

name: Hyperledger Seattle
description:
Does The Hyperledger Project have the potential to become the engine behind most successful decentralized applications and organizations created in the next 25-50 years? Absolutely!

A much better question is how, and in what new ways, can we:

a) Build decentralized applications, organizations and APIs at 10x the speed at 1/10 the cost.

b) Build situational awareness in the local community, as the convergence of decentralized applications, decentralized organizations, Artificial Intelligence and IoT brings upon us the Great Displacement of the 21st century, where the majority of workforce will be left without “conventional” jobs, forced to learn new skills and professions.

Why?

Because with Hyperledger we can.

Founders of this group believe that the Hyperledger Foundation will be the engine behind decentralization of the world, a massive economic change of the next 25-50 years.

So.... why don't we standardize and democratize the field with and around Hyperledger?

What.

We are a local micro community of those interested in advancing their knowledge of Hyperledger, its use cases and applications.

How.

Join our group for a regular dose of human interaction, conversations, smiles, food and drinks on all things Hyperledger:

• Use Cases

• Competitive Analysis of Hyperledger Startups (Distributed Apps from disruptive companies in specific vertical markets)

• How-To’s

• Interviews with individuals working at the edge of the Hyperledger project

• Reviews of tools, services and APIs offered by the Hyperledger ecosystem

• Best Practices in Application Architecture

• Do’s and Don’ts

• Application Templates

• Hackathons

• Security in the decentralized world - on the edge, on the node, in the cloud and in transit

We will learn how others solve some of the hard problems that exist in the world using Hyperledger.

Join the movement. Let’s change the world. Because with Hyperledger we can.

name: Westlake Village JavaScript Meetup
description: This is a group for anyone interested in JavaScript. Maybe you want to learn: Front-end, node.js, or computer science concepts. Or, maybe you want to teach by presenting your ideas and hard won knowledge or you feel comfortable mentoring someone just starting out. Perhaps you are looking to socialize with other people who work in JavaScript but can't drive to LA or Santa Barbara after work. This is a group in the Conejo Valley area focused on JavaScript. It doesn't matter where or how its used JavaScript can be learned for all parts of the stack. This group provides a safe learning environment to learn and socialize about JavaScript.

name: NodeJS Israel
description: A group to discuss Node.js, its frameworks, and best practices.

name: Mount Shasta Tour 2017
description:
Journey to the Inner Worlds of Mount Shasta for a Vision Quest
SHASTA TOUR 2017
Thursday Aug 4-7th
Laura Rose DesJardins and her staff want to welcome you to Mount Shasta You have been chosen by the Universe to be one of the people who will experience the profound spiritual transformation Mount Shasta offers. There will be many experiences that are part of the tour and the following pages will give you information about that. Laura and her staff wants this to be one of the best trips ever and we want you to rejuvenate at our lake retreat while we welcome in all the wisdom Shasta has to offer. The Tour price is $999.99 with a non refundable deposit of 499.00 due by Jan 15, 2017 to hold your spot. Tour includes meals, transportation once you're in Shasta and Sweat Lodge. Registration limited.

Laura is a Nationally recognized lecturer and teacher,Laura has been a professional Astrologer for the past 40 + years.Laura is a nationwide, multi-media personality, having been interviewed by CBS Radio, The NBC's "Today Show" and she has had articles in "People Magazine," "Orange Coast Magazine," the "Orange County Register" as well as three feature articles in the "Los Angeles Times Business Section." Laura has held "Staff Astrologer", positions at various radio stations and national magazine publications, and was a lecturer consultant to the exclusive "Golden Door Resort & Spa." Laura has also lectured with the Norwegian Cruise Lines, Princess Cruise lines and the Celebrity Cruise Lines. In addition, she is the author of the "Astro-Medical Wheel," "Time Passages," and an astrological report writer called "Midpoint Keys" by Matrix Software. Laura was interviewed by the Learning and Discovery Channel on a show called "Prophecies The Millennium and Prophecies of Nostradamus, She presently is the director of Southern California Astrological Network, which she founded in 1986 and was the former director of the Michigan Astrological Association. For more info contact Laura at 714-612-7335, astrologer2001@aol.com.


Welcome to your guided tour of Mount Shasta
led by Laura DesJardins and staff

Please stay in your heart. There will be circumstances where there is a lot of energy, so remember to breath and stay in your heart with everyone that you connect with in every situation as we are all on a vision quest which can take us into some very unusual spaces. If you do have any complaints, or problems, please take them to Laura directly for resolution. We want to make to the Tour the best for you and for those you will bond with as well as having the best possible experience.

Please be on time. The utmost respect you can give your fellow adventurers is the agreement to honor our time commitments each day as this will ultimately make the tour easier for you and for everyone involved.

Connect with your fellow adventurers.

Every person on this trip is incredible and highly interesting with their own story. We invite you to find out for yourself and connect to each person and get to know their special qualities which made them desire to attend this Tour as well as why the Mountain has chosen you as well as them.

Each day has an itinerary. We plan to honor the itinerary but situations come up where we as a group make the decision to do something different, so allow for the winds of change to greet and guide us into our next experience.

Remember to dress for the situation. It could be hot in August, so casual summer clothing is best, but Mount Shasta can get breezy and we will be going up to 8500 to 9000 plus feet, so bring a jacket and hiking attire. Glass Mountain is beautiful but as the name expresses, can be sharp, so if you have gloves bring them with you. Laura has led Tours to the Mountain of Glass for the past 20 years and so far no one has been cut by the black obsidian glass.


Mount Shasta (Sacred Visionary Site) Full Moon Eclipse in Aquarius There are many types of phenomena that occur on and or near Mt. Shasta as it exhibits strong frequencies that create light. All around the Mt. Shasta area there are extinct and dormant volcanoes, cinder cones, artesian springs, sacred caves and mystical caverns. The mountain carries a dominant power which seems to get stronger every day.

Over the last 70 years, numerous travelers have reported encounters with higher dimensional beings that live beneath and around this sacred Mountain. UFO sightings have also become so commonplace that there are books published with numerous photographs of sightings. Participants of vision quests, ceremonies and camping expeditions have all heard and felt the powerful vortex surrounding Mount Shasta

Mt. Shasta is a site where people gather to perform sweat lodges and purification ceremonies. The intense purification of steam and heat within the sweat lodge mimics what's going on inside of the mountain. The darkness of the lodge is almost maternal and stirs the goddess energy of one's spirit. The ceremony directs itself to the physical and spiritual cleansing of an individual, the same as the mountain cleanses our spirit.

Many experiences have been documented from people all over the world seeing UFO craft come in and out of the mountain, mysterious openings inside the mountain are also seen, where advanced inhabitants live. Vortex energies and portals along with mysterious lights have been seen that come from inside of the mountain. It is widely believed that there are civilizations of highly evolved beings residing within the mountain called the
Lemurians. Some are believed to be in another dimension that are not currently visible, yet at times many people have experienced a diverse range of phenomena that continues to expand the mysteries of this spiritual and sacred place

Stewart Mineral Springs

It is believed that the mineral waters flowing into the river are the most powerful healing waters on mother earth. There are many claims to the remarkable properties of the mineral water. Mental well-being, restoration of physical balance, and deep relaxation are common descriptions of one's experience. Some people even swear to healing; on many levels. Your experience will be unique to you, but the bathhouse, provides fresh spring water for your use and encourage you to fill personal containers with the water during your visit.

Every spring, on our planet, has unique properties. The waters that flow through Parks Creek have been honored for generations by the local tribes as a place to clean and clear. You're welcomed to join the experience and participate firsthand in the soothing qualities of the waters at Stewart Springs.

Dr. Emoto and the Stewart Springs Water Crystal In 2009, the eminent Dr. Emoto visited Stewart Springs with a small group of colleagues. He said that one of his senior Hado students was aware of the power of the waters and suggested a visit. One of the Hado teachers took a sample of the water directly from the creek near the Source House. That particular location is especially unusual as it is where the red springs (female), white springs (male) and fresh water flow together. The springs in Glastonbury, UK have similar properties. Those who are especially sensitive say they feel the higher vibration of the water in that area. The water sample was taken back to Japan where it was crystallized and photographed

Shasta Vision Quest Tour 2016
Thursday Aug 4 to Sunday Aug 7th 2017
WITH
LAURA ROSE DESJARDINS and Staff

DAY 1 THURSDAY
2 pm Orientation--get to know each other
3.23 pm Full Moon Ceremony on Mount Shasta and beginning of Readings by Laura
7:00 pm Dinner

DAY 2 FRIDAY
7-9:00 am Breakfast and light Yoga
10:00 am Trip to Pluto Caves
1:00 pm Lunch
2:00 Trip to Sacred Water Falls
7:00 pm dinner

DAY 3 SATURDAY
7-9:00 am Breakfast with light Yoga
10:00 am Journey Medicine Lake
11:00 pm Mountain of Glass ...then lunch
5:00 pm Sweat Lodge with Walking Eagle
7:00 pm Dinner DAY 4 SUNDAY
7-9 am Breakfast
10:00 am Puja at Mount Shasta and completion of readings
1:00 pm Lunch
3:00 pm Closing Ceremony
Our schedule often changes with the winds of time and we'll find that the group has a mind of its own taking on its own identity. It's very important though, to stay with the group as much as possible to keep our Astrological family (North Node Energy) together. We also need to keep our thoughts in the present moment and our energy as pure as possible. Laura wants to make this tour one of the best experiences for you, so it's important to arrive at all events on time and stay with the group as opposed to separating. We will have plenty of separate time, especially when we are on Mount Shasta. Walking Eagle, Gentle Springs, Badger Woman, Sparrow Hawk and Spirit of Wind staff welcome you to a sacred Sweat Lodge Purification Ceremony. "Taking a sweat" is a traditional way of cleansing the body, mind and spirit. Through the sweat ceremony we can eliminate toxins from our physical body and create a space to allow our inner spirit to listen and reflect for days and weeks after. All are welcomed; all are honored.
Surrounded by majestic trees and the sounds of the creek, we begin by lighting a bon fire that heats the stones to be used inside the lodge. During this process, you are invited to join in the drumming and chanting, or you might choose to sit and enjoy the ceremony. You are also invited to offer your loving thoughts by taking a pinch of tobacco and contributing to the fire. Please feel free to contribute or ask questions.
Once inside the lodge, Walking Eagle will speak and invite all participants to offer their words and thoughts. With the glowing rocks and the darkened space, this is a deeply profound experience. If at anytime you feel discomfort, the flap door will be immediately be opened and you may exit to cool down. The Karuk Tribe and Stewart Mineral Springs extend a heartfelt invitation to you for this unique ceremony.
Respectful guidelines:
Alcohol, marijuana, and other altering drugs affect the ceremony in an unhealthy way. Please refrain using within 24 hours prior to the ceremony.
Clothing is required. For your comfort, please wear clothing that is loose fitting; preferably cotton or other natural fabrics.Please bring water and a towel.
Women on their moon cycle are invited to participate at a Moon Lodge rather than the male/female sweat lodge. A traditional sweat experience embraces spiritual rebirth which clashes with a woman's sacred power of birth. It is not appropriate for women on their moon to participate with others on a different cycle. If you are on your moon cycle, please participate in a woman only Moon Lodge Ceremony. We hold your power in the highest respect.
There is no charge for a sweat. However, The Spirit of the Wind staff suggest $30 to $35 donation. Sweat Lodge Ceremony starts on Saturday at 6pm and drumming Circle At 5:30 pm.

organizer.name: Laura Rose DesJardins
organizer.bio:
Laura DesJardins 

Nationally recognized lecturer and teacher, has been a professional Astrologer for the past 30+ years. Her specialty is the gift to forecast future trends and cycles. Laura is the Director of SCAN.

name: Aix-en-Provence WebTech Meetup
description: Rencontrons nous pour discuter des technologies du web (Django, Twitter Bootstrap,  Node.js, LAMP stack...), de services sur internet (Amazon EC2, OpenStreetMap, Github...), de solutions logiciels (Wordpress, Dolibarr, Zabbix), de projet de création d'entreprise, d'applications web et mobiles. Ce groupe permet de se rencontrer dans un cadre informel, d'échanger des idées, des expériences, des bonne pratiques. Partageons nos connaissances pour aider les projets des innovateurs en herbe d'Aix-Marseille.

organizer.name: Jean-Paul CARMONA
organizer.bio: co-fondateur de CatchU http://catchu.fr un outilleur numérique pour projets sur internet, d'un FabLab http://fuvlab.fr, enseignant en école d'ingénieur informatique, et consultant freelance en informatique http://jpca.fr

name: Full Stack Web Development
description:
Our meetup is an event where web designers and developers can come together to learn from and teach each other about emerging technologies. While speakers at Full Stack focus primarily on angularjs, react, node, hapiJS, espress, plain ole' JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, we encourage all local web professionals to join us for vivid discussions around technology across the stack in any language.

Hang & Code: After the talks, you're also welcome to make use of our desk space and team rooms while you're here, so feel free to bring a project to hack on after the talks.

name: PHP, Bash, JavaScript, etc., on Linux (Mint XFCE) using Vim
description:
This group is about using Linux and Vim for development and problems with the platform as they arise. The old saying "Emacs is a great OS, lacking only a decent editor" should be replaced in today's world with "Vim is a great OS, IDE, and editor"! I live within vim. If I need to open a libreoffice spreadsheet I do it from within vim. Ditto for browsers and everything else. Linux, and in particular Linux Mint XFCE, is a great OS. It works with almost all new and old hardware. And the peripherals you may have. And it isn't changing out from under you all the time. It stays out of the way to let you concentrate.

Concentrate on what though? The idea behind this group is to be a place where you can come to ask questions and see how other people have done things. For instance how to setup an environment for working on node.js. Or how to replace your bash script with php or javaScript. As it being a new group it will naturally take the direction of what interests the members. We'll be meeting at the "Froyo Heavenly Cafe" which has a good internet connection, seating, and of course coffee.

name: Surrey Software Development Meetup
description:
this meetup will be about learning Angular 1 and 2, we'll do some practice examples, get some stuff set-up on how to install and build and angular app. were really hoping for a good turn out. we got an office down here on king george and 73rd ave, and so it has a great meeting room. we'll be doing a 6 week kind of course potentially two days a week. where this will include as well an install, we'll try to provision it to an online server, get a node backend with mongo going. we will also be using and showing .Net rest services. these are the technologies.

.Net
Angular 1,2
Node Js
Mongo
Mongoose
SQL Azure
Heroku

etc.

what the goal is to get you familiar with the technology, have a showcase to present and learn how to deploy and install

organizer.name: nadim_sayani
organizer.bio: I'm am Owner, Developer, Project Manager, Leader, Sales Person, Marketer individual with many different hats. I love to meet people and know my community. I like to contribute something

name: JavaScript in the SF East Bay
description:
A group for people in the SF East Bay who love/use/want to learn JavaScript, including libraries like jQuery, Angular, Ember, React and many more. We'll also cover plenty of Node.js related topics!

There is something for everyone to learn, from novices to experts alike.

organizer.name: Tim
organizer.bio: Co-founder and lead instructor at https://www.rithmschool.com

name: Meteor São Paulo
description: Grupo criado para reunir pessoas interessadas em conhecer / aprender / ensinar / testar / desenvolver aplicações utilizando o framework Meteor.js. Meteor é uma plataforma open-source para desenvolvimento rápido de aplicações web de alta qualidade, indicada para quem está apenas começando ou para quem já é expert. Uma aplicação Meteor é um mix de Javascript que roda dentro de um web browser, Javascript que roda no no lado servidor Meteor dentro de um container Node.js, fragmentos HTML, regras CSS e conteúdos estáticos (imagens, vídeos, etc.).
